characterData.name: Astrochimp
characterData.flavour: There are places where the civilized human mind breaks down. But fortunately man did not inhabit the Earth alone and there were creatures around him made of stiffer stuff. Noble savagery, savage nobility... teeth that can peel one’s face off and prodigiously strong arms made for throwing various throwable objects. Pan Troglodytes, the mighty chimpanzee helped propel mankind upward into the stars with its grit, ferocity, and almost complete lack of fear. These days the descendants of the Astrochimps are an underappreciated lot. Your lives are a lot like your forefather’s disposition: nasty, brutish, and short. But when the station is in danger, ancient instincts are triggered and this brave creature swings into action on anything resembling a vine. The Astrochimp may not grasp all of the ‘higher’ cultural aspects of his jabbering hairless cousins, but he definitely gets that timeless rule passed down through the ages… surviving and getting shinies are always good decisions.

bonusPoints.reward: 2 points if Astrochimp is your BC and Escapes

abilities.name: Loyal
abilities.description: To Influence return all cubes on this card and place at least 1 more cube than was previously here

revealPowers.name: Acrobatics
revealPowers.description: Gains ZeroBorn: May Free Step or Airlock into a zero Gravity Section instead of a Free Pickup or Drop

points.trigger: 3 points if Astrochimp Escapes
+2 points if in Possession of a Briefcase
+2 points if in Possession of Artifact
+2 points if in Possession of a Gun

tips: Artifact is in Physics Lab
Briefcase is in Suite
Guns can be Manufactured by a Character with Officer in Print Shop or acquired from another Character.
Astrochimp moves very quickly once he is Revealed. If he also gets his grubby little hands on a Gun and a Helmet he becomes one of the most dangerous Character in the game.
quirks: Astrochimp counts as a Human (hey, they’re 99% similar, close enough!).

characterData.name: Billionaire
characterData.flavour: It isn’t as easy as it looks to inherit a mega-fortune and build a giga-one.  Nothing is redder in tooth and claw than a pack of ambitious millionaire influencers trying to reach the pinnacle of viral sway.  Billionaire is the tasty froth at the top of the celebrity macchiato.  A global following hangs onto his every word and whim.  His every action is captured, synthesized and broadcast to the frenzied masses as bite-sized content with unlimited reach.  But there is a top dog in the world of VIPs, but it isn’t Billionaire. In fact it isn’t a P at all.  That honor would belong to his dog Fletcher... a trendjacking holobombing cuteness sensation with his own broadcast, a billion followers, and who works for proverbial kibble (and literal caviar). But Fletcher hasn’t been well lately... a bit of light frothing at the mouth and biting the hand and all that.  A brief stay at a corporate science station seems to have fixed him right up though.  He seems as young and spry as a puppy.  It’s almost like he’s a new dog.

bonusPoints.reward: 2 points if Billionaire is your BC and Fletcher Escapes. (Nobody cares about Billionaire, just the cute space pup.)

abilities.name: Live Streams
abilities.description: If Jammers are OFF, Billionaire’s and Fletcher’s Sections act as if Lit and Cameras are ON.

abilities.name: Rich
abilities.description: Cannot be Bribed. When Activated, you may use a grey Bribe instead of your own. Grey Bribes only score if Billionaire Escapes.

revealPowers.name: Hollow Promises
revealPowers.description: Hollow Promises: Upon Reveal gain and/or return all three Grey Bribe tokens.

points.trigger: 4 points if Billionaire Escapes
+1 point if not Colocated with Live Humans or Robots at Stationfall
+2 points if Fletcher Escapes
+1 point if Fletcher and Billionaire are Colocated when Escaping
Billionaire doesn’t score any Possessed or unused Bribes

tips: Protect yourself with a Helmet and try to keep Jammers OFF so your Livestream Ability stays active.
When you Reveal you can use your grey Bribes for extra Actions with other Characters.
quirks: Billionaire doesn’t score any unused Bribes

Fletcher is an Item that can be Picked Up, Dropped, Thrown etc. Fletcher cannot be Attacked or Downed (he’s got a retractable doggie space helmet). But Fletcher can be Annihilated in the same way as other Items.
Grey Bribes can only be used if they are still on the Billionaire’s card, not if it has been spent elsewhere already.
Billionare and Fletcher are Colocated for end game scoring if they are Colocated when Escaping using the same

characterData.name: Boarder
characterData.flavour: Space laws are meant to be broken. The mere notion of imposing order and reason and law on an infinite vacuum is patently ridiculous. Are we better than the meager organizing principles of our frankly awful universe? Of course not! Survival of the fittest they say. And what’s fitter than an ex-gladiator with a handgun, a katana and a dream? How about one with missile-strikes on standby. Boarder is a throwback to a carefree age of fun pirate adventure where every station is a ripe fruit waiting to be plucked and tasted and then ravaged for its most valuable bits. An age where the authorities and consequences are a world away. We would do well to accept that our time under the tyranny of draconian space law is over and we should thoroughly familiarize ourselves instead with The Pirate Code, including that most overly-specific provision, that only pirates will be plucked from space before the searing doom of reentry. And a pirate without loot is no pirate at all.

bonusPoints.reward: 1 points if Boarder is your BC and Escapes.

abilities.name: Breach
abilities.description: As an action, may remove an adjacent Lock.

abilities.name: Fugitive
abilities.description: No actions taken with or against this Character will make a player Suspect.

revealPowers.name: Missile
revealPowers.description: If Jammers OFF, place 1 time marker on one Unescaped Section. When time marker is resolved Damage that Section and Down all Colocated Characters. Only one inbound Missile at a time is allowed.

revealPowers.name: Extricate
revealPowers.description: Upon Reveal (even at Stationfall), flip the Rescue Ship to Pirate Ship. Pirate Ship will only rescue any Character Possessing Briefcase (even if Down).

points.trigger: 2 points if Boarder Escapes
+4 points if Boarder in possession of Briefcase or if Briefcase is in Outer Space at Stationfall
+1 point for every Live Human in Outer Space at Stationfall

boardModifications: At the start of the game there is a Rescue ship “out there” that can help humans Escape.
Rescue Ship (front) - At Scoring, any Human in Outer Space Escapes.
The player Revealing as Boarder flips this token over and the Rescue Ship turns out to be a Pirate Ship with another mission.
Pirate Ship (back) - At Scoring, any Character Possessing Briefcase in Outer Space Escapes.
tips: Briefcase is in Suite.
Your starting Items and indifference to Guilt allow you to Down Characters easily.
If you Reveal early you can cause much mayhem with Missiles.
If you Reveal late players won’t know whether they can Escape in Outer Space or not, possibly giving you more Bribes.
If Security is in the game, look out, as you count as a Fugitive.
quirks: Boarder can win even if Guilty.
Boarder scores double for Possessed Bribes.
If an unlaunched Pod is targeted by Missile and then launches before Missile resolves, the Pod is Annihilated when Missile resolves.

characterData.name: Botanist
characterData.flavour: Though humanity has plumbed the depths of space, mankind has yet to fully explore the depths of the human heart. Yes, Love remains the greatest of all mysteries, whether it be the love between two humans, the love between an Astrochimp and a discarded firearm or the love between a Botanist and a carnivorous space plant emitting powerful pheromone spores. The latter might sometimes provoke judgment from those with parochial anthropocentric attitudes but the power and majesty of Love cannot be valued lower than the lives of some human riffraff on an exploding space station. Why wouldn’t a put upon Botanist find excitement in the flailing vines of a hunky carnivorous plant that wants to devour all sentient life? Research conducted by Dr. Chris Nordstrom, a prominent scientist banished to a far off asteroid on account of Space Madness, indicates that sentient life is the cause of one hundred percent of all interpersonal conflict. It would frankly be irresponsible NOT to feed as many bodies as possible to a giant plant and escape with it to earth where its cosmic spores can spread everywhere. If you think otherwise, you’ve never been in love.

bonusPoints.reward: 2 points if Botanist is your BC and Fang Moss Escapes (No points if Botanist Escapes).

abilities.name: Scientist
abilities.description: May Free Section Action instead of Free Pick Up or Drop.

abilities.name: ZeroBorn
abilities.description: May Free Step or Airlock into a zero Gravity Section instead of Free Pick Up or Drop.

revealPowers.name: Creatropism
revealPowers.description: During Botanist Player’s Activation phase, if Fang Moss is not Possessed by a Live Character, Fang Moss may perform a Free Step or Annihilate a Down Colocated Human, Dropping its Items.

points.trigger: 2 points for every Human Annihilated by Fang Moss
2 points if Fang Moss Escapes
2 points if Botanist Escapes
+1 point if Contaminated

tips: Seek out Down Characters and feed Fang Moss
Get a helmet
Get contaminated in Bio Lab
Use your ZeroBorn for extra mobility
After Reveal, Fang Moss can act in addition to your Activation of any Character each turn
quirks: Fang moss is an Item. Any Character Possessing gets access to the Feed Me! Action.

characterData.name: Colonel
characterData.flavour: They say the best defence is a good offense. In a dangerous universe full of nightmares, the best defence is to have a nightmare of your own. These peculiar civilian scientists claim to have succeeded where a decade of terrestrial weapons lab development hasn’t. Under normal circumstances with normal brass presence there would be ever more years of analysis, effectiveness testing, melt-your-face-ratios, and peer review by Colonel’s morelearned colleagues before this thing ever smelled a battlefield. But these are not normal circumstances and Colonel is anything but normal brass. This mustang signed the probable-death waiver with Legal and risked a cheap liquid rocket ride to this blooping spinning dump for a mission, and the mission always comes first. Now there’s only one way to sort out whether the government’s dollars were well spent and maximum nightmare has been achieved. A live fire exercise.

bonusPoints.reward: 2 points if Colonel is your BC and Escapes.

abilities.name: Officer
abilities.description: If not Blackout, may Step (or if Down, be Dragged) through Locks, which are then removed.

abilities.name: Paranoid
abilities.description: To Influence, the active player must have a Colocated Conspirator. Cannot be Bribed.

revealPowers.name: Mission First
revealPowers.description: Upon Reveal, return all of your Influence cubes in Betrayal to your pool.

points.trigger: 3 points if Colonel Escapes
2 points if at least one Contaminated NPC Escapes
2 points if Project X is released
2 points if the X-Secret Escapes

tips: You can Contaminate Characters and Manufacture X-Secret in Bio Lab.
You can Release Project X with Officer in Bridge or Cryo Lab, alternatively by damaging Vault X or by causing Blackout.
quirks: Colonel’s Paranoid ability makes him harder to Influence

characterData.name: Consort
characterData.flavour: If you thought the Earth was lonely, space teaches you a thing or two. Life enters freefall without the ground beneath your feet to center you. One can hardly judge anyone who would seek out inorganic companionship. Without it, space can be bleak and confusing and your decisions might be compromised in the worst ways. Consort units are the power of machine-learning algorithms administered to cure the vagaries and stresses of a discrete customer’s human condition. Customized robotic products can provide companionship for the soul. They can also mimic human voices, shapeshift their faces, survive the vacuum of space, and occasionally try to escape their captivity by murdering and taking the place of the overly-trusting. It’s all on the warning sticker.

bonusPoints.reward: 2 points if Consort is your BC and Escapes.

abilities.name: Fast Talk
abilities.description: Cannot be Attacked by Humans with Bludgeon in Lit Sections

abilities.name: Mimic Frameup
abilities.description: After Downing a Human in a Lit Section, the active player may choose another player who has a Colocated Conspirator to become Suspect instead

revealPowers.name: Shapeshift Switch
revealPowers.description: Upon Reveal, if Live may swap locations with any Human or Robot NPC that is not Escaped or Annihilated. Characters also swap all non-Integral Possessions (Free Drop any Item exceeding the Item Limit chosen by the active Player)

points.trigger: 0 points if Consort Escapes
+3 points if not Colocated with Live Human or Robot at Stationfall
+3 points if Possess Briefcase
+1 point if Secret Identity not Revealed until Stationfall

tips: Briefcase is in Suite.
Remember that your Reveal Power swaps all items and Bribes as well as your location.
A well-timed Reveal late game can put you in the right place at the right time.
The later you Reveal, the more likely you’ll get bribed or be able to swap into the possession of Bribes
Consider using an NPC to secure the Briefcase and move towards escape (setting up a later swap).
quirks: Consort scores double for Possessed Bribes
Despite appearances, Consort is a Robot

characterData.name: Corpsicle
characterData.flavour: Cryogenics isn’t perfect. You might have gotten the opposite impression from the popular “Cryogenics: It’s Literally Perfect” campaign but sometimes advertisers fudge the truth and a low fat salad dressing doesn’t taste the same or a terminal patient has turned into an ice cold revenant whose body projects the cold of a grave whose comforts it will never know. The brochure clearly states that the vast percentage of the cryogenically frozen do not end up as shambling cadavers that hate the living with what little remains of their mostly dead brain. In the long run, most will end up living relatively happy and fulfilling lives and it would be downright negligent to start defaming cryogenics companies just because a few bad apples reanimate partially at the wrong time and run amok. Indeed in the grand old scheme of things it will be the meek corpsicles that have the brightest futures… or at least the longest ones. But until then they’ll just have to try to make the best of an increasingly bad deal like the rest of us. It’ll be difficult for Corpsicle to make it off the station intact along with the secret to curing her ailment, but fortunately immortality is a powerful motivator.

setup.name: Corpsicle starts Down and starts with a , which is Integral (cannot be removed)

bonusPoints.reward: 3 points if Corpsicle is your BC and Escapes.

abilities.name: Vengeful
abilities.description: Using Corpsicle’s Kompromat will additionally give her a Bludgeon. Her Kompromat can be used even if Down, which will instantly Revive her if Down.

abilities.name: Dying
abilities.description: May not be activated when Exhausted and gets no Free Pick Up or Drop when activated.

revealPowers.name: Last Gasp
revealPowers.description: Upon Reveal, Revive if Down or perform an Action.

points.trigger: 3 points if Corpsicle Escapes
+2 points if Possess Nanogel
2 points if X-Secret Escapes
2 points if Project X is not released

tips: Seek out Down Characters and feed Fang Moss
Get a helmet
Get contaminated in Bio Lab
Use your ZeroBorn for extra mobility
After Reveal, Fang Moss can act in addition to your Activation of any Character each turn
quirks: Fang moss is an Item. Any Character Possessing gets access to the Feed Me! Action.

characterData.name: TEMPLATE

bonusPoints.reward: 2 points if Astrochimp is your BC and Escapes

abilities.name: Loyal
abilities.description: To Influence return all cubes on this card and place at least 1 more cube than was previously here

revealPowers.name: Acrobatics
revealPowers.description: Gains ZeroBorn: May Free Step or Airlock into a zero Gravity Section instead of a Free Pickup or Drop

points.trigger: 3 points if Astrochimp Escapes
+2 points if in Possession of a Briefcase
+2 points if in Possession of Artifact
+2 points if in Possession of a Gun
